unnormalised: It all started when my grandmother, Dadi, had a fall. Suddenly, terms like "Ayushman Bharat Health Account (ABHA) ID" and "Unique Health Identification (UHID)" were being thrown around. Until then, I'd only associated identifiers with my own PAN card or Aadhaar. Now, the hospital staff kept asking for Dadi's UHID, which none of us knew. Turns out, it was supposed to be on her hospital card from her previous stay. A frantic search ensued.
normalised: it all started when my grandmother, Dadi, had a fall. Suddenly, terms like "A-B-H-A I-D" and "U-H-I-D" were being thrown around. Until then, I'd only associated identifiers with my own P-A-N card or Aadhaar. Now, the hospital staff kept asking for Dadi's U-H-I-D, which none of us knew. Turns out, it was supposed to be on her hospital card from her previous stay. A frantic search ensued.

unnormalised: My cousin, Rahul, the techie in the family, jumped into action. He explained that the ABHA ID, also known as a health ID, is meant to streamline access to medical records. He started researching how to get a new one for Dadi since we couldn't find the UHID. He pulled up the National Health Authority website and began the process. He needed Dadi’s Aadhaar number, 9876-5432-1012, and her registered mobile number.
normalised: My cousin, Rahul, the techie in the family, jumped into action. He explained that the A-B-H-A I-D, also known as a health I-D, is meant to streamline access to medical records. He started researching how to get a new one for Dadi since we couldn't find the U-H-I-D. He pulled up the National Health Authority website and began the process. He needed Dadi’s Aadhaar number, nine eight seven six dash five four three two dash one zero one two, and her registered mobile number.

unnormalised: The online form also asked for details about her insurance policy. Apparently, her Star Health Insurance policy number, SHI/2023/123456, could be linked to the ABHA ID. Rahul said this linking could help in faster claim processing. We had just renewed her policy on 10/07/2024 so thankfully we had those details handy. The agent, Mr. Sharma, had emphasized keeping it safe.

unnormalised: The entire process took almost an hour, but we finally got Dadi her ABHA ID. Rahul even downloaded the ABHA app on his phone. He showed me how all her medical reports could eventually be linked, making it easier for doctors to access her history. It seemed like a huge step towards modernizing healthcare. The doctor, Dr. Kapoor, at the hospital even mentioned how the govt. is pushing for universal adoption of these identifiers.

unnormalised: While Dadi recovered, I started to understand the importance of these health identifiers. It’s not just about a number; it's about ensuring seamless access to quality healthcare for everyone, especially seniors who might not always remember the details themselves. Even the local chemist started asking if customers have an ABHA ID so they could link prescriptions. It's clear that the ABHA ID and UHID are becoming an integral part of the Indian healthcare landscape, and it’s something we all need to be aware of.
